intro: Tolpis filiformis, commonly known as the slender leaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and has linear, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a circular pattern, giving it a daisy-like appearance. Tolpis filiformis is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
